page.title: 04LIBRARY
page.content: Maldon is a busy town especially on a Thursday-market day.One of the bus- iest junctions is at the top of Market Hill where it joins the High Street.At this junction is an old building which was originally St Peters Church.Only the tower is still standing.This dates from the thirteenth century and is made from pebbles set in cement.The nave of the church was rebuilt after it had collapsed in 1665 and was then used as a grammar school. The building now houses 2 libraries. On the first floor is the Plume Libr- ary so called after Thomas Plume who died in 1704 and left the town his large book collection.It has about six thousand books-many of these are first editions.On the ground floor is the Public Lending Library.Although small, it is well used and an important part of town life.
